DataElement.preferredName: Bone Marrow Biopsy Myeloid Precursor Involvement Specimen Percentage Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent the percentage of erythroid precursors in a bone marrow specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Bone Marrow Biopsy Myeloid Precursor Involvement
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes._The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis._A type of white blood cell. Neutrophils, eosinophils, and basophils are granulocytes._A substance from which another substance is formed._To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The soft tissue filling the cavities of bones. Bone marrow exists in two types, yellow and red. Yellow marrow is found in the large cavities of large bones and consists mostly of fat cells and a few primitive blood cells. Red marrow is a hematopoietic tissue and is the site of production of erythrocytes and granular leukocytes. Bone marrow is made up of a framework of connective tissue containing branching fibers with the frame being filled with marrow cells (MSH98):Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body.

Concepts.definition: The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.
The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with or resembling the bone marrow. May also refer to certain types of hematopoietic (blood-forming) cells found in the bone marrow. Sometimes used as a synonym for myelogenous; for example, acute myeloid leukemia and acute myelogenous leukemia are the same disease.:A substance from which another substance is formed.:To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

Concepts.definition: A type of white blood cell. Neutrophils, eosinophils, and basophils are granulocytes.
A substance from which another substance is formed.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a percentage for a hematologic laboratory value.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to use in NCI CCR Biomarker eCRF.10.25.2016.dmr
